alert.note: Alert for Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 05 at 5:27PM EDT until April 05 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Tornado Warning for portions of... Bryan County in southeastern Georgia... Bulloch County in southeastern Georgia... Effingham County in southeastern Georgia... Chatham County in southeastern Georgia... Jasper County in southeastern South Carolina... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 527 PM EDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Pembroke, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Law enforcement confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include: Pooler, Springfield, Pembroke, Savannah International Airport, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Godley Station, Downtown Savannah, Lanier, Rincon, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Hardeeville, Bloomingdale, Guyton and Egypt. This warning includes the following interstates: I-16 between mile markers 132 and 159. I-516 between mile markers 7 and 9. I-95 in South Carolina between mile markers 2 and 13. I-95 in Georgia between mile markers 101 and 112. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
